submitter_user.about: Gunnar Morling is a software engineer and open-source enthusiast by heart. He is leading the Debezium project, a distributed platform for change data capture. He is a Java Champion, the spec lead for Bean Validation 2.0 (JSR 380) and has founded multiple open source projects such as JfrUnit, Layrry, and MapStruct. Gunnar is an avid blogger ([morling.dev](https://morling.dev/)) and has spoken at a wide range of conferences like QCon, Java One, Devoxx, JavaZone, and many others.

title: Intelligence is not Enough
description: One of the most common attitudes with respect to AI today is the so-called ‚Äúdoomerism,‚Äù the idea that AI technologies are inevitably fated to present an existential risk to humanity. This talk takes that idea on head first, systematically examining the theoretical risks versus the reality on the ground, taking a skeptical but thoughtful view to how we balance the potential of the technology with the varying risks AI may - or may not - represent.
description_plain: One of the most common attitudes with respect to AI today is the so-called ‚Äúdoomerism,‚Äù the idea that AI technologies are inevitably fated to present an existential risk to humanity. This talk takes that idea on head first, systematically examining the theoretical risks versus the reality on the ground, taking a skeptical but thoughtful view to how we balance the potential of the technology with the varying risks AI may - or may not - represent.

title: On harmful overuse of std::move

submitter_user.about:
Used and enjoyed many platforms including DOS, C64, OS/2, Mac, Linux, Solaris, Windows, and NT. Have contributed to several OSS projects including Mozilla, Putty and Pidgin, and have written a few OSS projects of my own such as sdir, antinat, wincvt, serenity audio player. Currently working for Microsoft in Azure, and previously contributed to XP through Win10, on NTFS, ReFS, WOF (compression), and many related storage technologies.

[Personal website](http://www.malsmith.net/)

submitter_user.about: Gunnar Morling is a software engineer and open-source enthusiast by heart. He is leading the Debezium project, a distributed platform for change data capture. He is a Java Champion, the spec lead for Bean Validation 2.0 (JSR 380) and has founded multiple open source projects such as JfrUnit, Layrry, and MapStruct. Gunnar is an avid blogger ([morling.dev](https://morling.dev/)) and has spoken at a wide range of conferences like QCon, Java One, Devoxx, JavaZone, and many others.
